SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.SignatureModel
uk.msci.project.rsa.AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking
uk.msci.project.rsa.SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking
public class SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking extends AbstractSignatureModelBenchmarking
This class is part of the Model component specific to digital signature operations providing methods to sign data and verify signatures. It encapsulates the data and the logic required to keep track of a user initiated digital signature scheme.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking()
    Constructs a new SignatureModel without requiring an initial key representative of the fact that at program launch, the model does not have any state: until it is initiated by the user

  • Constructor Details

    • SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking

      public SignatureModelComparisonBenchmarking()
      Constructs a new SignatureModel without requiring an initial key representative of the fact that at program launch, the model does not have any state: until it is initiated by the user

  • Method Details

    • batchCreateSignatures

      public void batchCreateSignatures(File batchMessageFile, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException, ExecutionException, InterruptedException
      Processes a batch of messages to create digital signatures in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode. This mode involves generating signatures using a variety of keys created with different parameter settings (or key configurations chosen by the user or set by default ) for each selected key size. For each key size, this method generates signatures using specified number of keys corresponding to each key configuration and hash function combination. The method updates the progress of signature generation using the provided progressUpdater consumer.
      Parameters:
      batchMessageFile - The file containing the messages to be signed in the batch process.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the batch signing process.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an I/O error reading from the batchMessageFile.
      ExecutionException
      InterruptedException

    • batchVerifySignatures

      public void batchVerifySignatures(File batchMessageFile, File batchSignatureFile, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Processes a batch of messages and their corresponding signatures for verification in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode. This mode involves verifying signatures using a variety of public keys created with different parameter settings for each selected key size. For each key size, this method verifies signatures using a specified number of keys with corresponding to each key configuration and hash function combination. The method updates the progress of signature verification using the provided progressUpdater consumer.
      Parameters:
      batchMessageFile - The file containing the messages to be verified.
      batchSignatureFile - The file containing the corresponding signatures to be verified.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the batch verification process.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an I/O error reading from the files.

    • batchVerifySignaturesForRecovery

      public void batchVerifySignaturesForRecovery(File batchMessageFile, File batchSignatureFile, DoubleConsumer progressUpdater) throws IOException
      Processes a batch of messages and their corresponding signatures for verification in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode for message recovery schemes.
      Parameters:
      batchMessageFile - The file containing the messages to be verified.
      batchSignatureFile - The file containing the corresponding signatures to be verified.
      progressUpdater - A consumer to update the progress of the batch verification process.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is an I/O error reading from the files.

    • getCurrentFixedHashTypeList_ComparisonMode

      public List<HashFunctionSelection> getCurrentFixedHashTypeList_ComparisonMode()
      Retrieves the current list of fixed hash types set for the comparison mode, representing hash types under standard parameters.
      Returns:
      List of pairs of DigestType and Boolean indicating provable security.

    • getCurrentProvableHashTypeList_ComparisonMode

      public List<HashFunctionSelection> getCurrentProvableHashTypeList_ComparisonMode()
      Retrieves the current list of provable hash types set for the comparison mode, representing hash types under provably secure parameters.
      Returns:
      List of pairs of DigestType and Boolean indicating provable security.

    • createDefaultKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMap

      public void createDefaultKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMap()
      Initialises the keyConfigToHashFunctionsMap with values based on the number of key sizes and groups for default comparison mode (provably secure vs standard). This map determines the hash functions used for each group of keys.

    • getNumKeySizesForComparisonMode

      public int getNumKeySizesForComparisonMode()
      Retrieves the number of different key sizes selected for generating/verifying signatures in the cross-parameter comparison mode of benchmarking. This method is relevant in scenarios where the signature creation/verification process is tested across various key sizes, each potentially having different parameter settings (standard vs. provably secure). It provides the count of distinct key sizes that have been chosen for benchmarking, facilitating the process of comparing performance across these varied configurations.
      Returns:
      The number of different key sizes selected for generating signatures in the comparison mode.

    • setNumKeysPerKeySizeComparisonMode

      public void setNumKeysPerKeySizeComparisonMode(int numKeysPerKeySizeComparisonMode)
      Sets the number of keys to be generated per key size in the comparison mode. Each key size will have this specified number of keys generated.
      Parameters:
      numKeysPerKeySizeComparisonMode - The number of keys to be generated for each key size.

    • setKeyConfigurationStrings

      public void setKeyConfigurationStrings(List<String> keyConfigurationStrings)
      Sets the key configuration strings that describe various key parameter configurations used in the signature scheme. Each string in the list represents a specific key configuration, which to be used for benchmarking different key configurations in the signature process.
      Parameters:
      keyConfigurationStrings - A list of strings representing different key configurations.

    • setKeysPerGroup

      public void setKeysPerGroup(int keysPerGroup)
      Sets the number of keys to be considered as a group for the purpose of applying different hash functions in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode.
      Parameters:
      keysPerGroup - The number of keys per group.

    • getKeysPerGroup

      public int getKeysPerGroup()
      Retrieves the number of keys that are considered as a group in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode.
      Returns:
      The number of keys per group.

    • setKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMap

      public void setKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMap(Map<Integer,List<HashFunctionSelection>> keyConfigToHashFunctionsMap)
      Sets the mapping of key configurations to corresponding hash functions for use in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode.
      Parameters:
      keyConfigToHashFunctionsMap - The map linking key configurations to hash functions.

    • getKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMap

      public Map<Integer,List<HashFunctionSelection>> getKeyConfigToHashFunctionsMap()
      Retrieves the mapping of key configurations to corresponding hash functions used in the cross-parameter benchmarking/comparison mode.
      Returns:
      The map linking key configurations to hash functions.

    • getTrialsPerKeyByGroup

      public int[] getTrialsPerKeyByGroup()
      Retrieves the number of trials assigned to each key by group in the comparison mode. This method is essential for accessing the specific number of trials conducted for each key, which is crucial for accurate performance analysis and benchmarking in comparison mode.
      Returns:
      An array of integers, each representing the number of trials for a key in each group.

    • calculateTotalHashFunctions

      public void calculateTotalHashFunctions()
      Calculates the total number of hash functions used across all groups in the comparison mode. This method iterates through the hash functions mapped to each group and aggregates their count, providing a comprehensive view of the hash function diversity in the benchmarking process.

    • getTotalHashFunctions

      public int getTotalHashFunctions()
      Retrieves the total number of hash functions used across all groups in the comparison mode benchmarking.
      Returns:
      The total number of hash functions used in the benchmarking process.

    • getTotalGroups

      public int getTotalGroups()
      Retrieves the total number of groups formed in the comparison mode. Each group represents a unique combination of key configurations or hash * functions.
      Returns:
      The total number of groups.

    • computeTrialsPerKeyByGroup

      public void computeTrialsPerKeyByGroup(int numTrials)
      Computes and sets the number of trials to be conducted per key for each group in the comparison mode. This method takes the total number of trials and distributes them across groups based on the number of hash functions in each group.
      Parameters:
      numTrials - The total number of trials to be conducted.

    • calculateNumBenchmarkingRuns

      public int calculateNumBenchmarkingRuns()
      Calculates the total number of benchmarking runs needed for the comparison mode. This method considers the number of groups, keys per group, and the number of hash functions within each group to determine the total number of benchmarking runs required.
      Returns:
      The total number of benchmarking runs.

    • getNumBenchmarkingRuns

      public int getNumBenchmarkingRuns()
      Retrieves the total number of benchmarking runs to be performed over a message set
      Returns:
      The total number of benchmarking runs.

    • getTotalWork

      public int getTotalWork()
      Retrieves the total amount of work to be done for the comparison mode benchmarking. This value represents the total number of signature operations (signing and verification) across all keys, hash functions, and trials in the comparison mode.
      Returns:
      The total work for the comparison mode benchmarking.
